intro: Hieracium finsaetense, commonly known as the Finsaetense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture. Hieracium finsaetense is often found in rocky or gravelly areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
